sentence.Network_en: They talked modestly of their valiant efforts to keep the tanker afloat.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们说起自己设法使油轮漂浮的英勇之举时非常谦虚。

sentence.Network_en: The tanker failed to respond to a command to stop.
sentence.Network_cn: 这辆罐车没有按照命令停下来。

sentence.Network_en: An oil tanker spewed its cargo into the sea.
sentence.Network_cn: 一艘油轮将装载的油全都泄入了大海。

entry.tran: (运输大量气体或液体的)巨轮;(尤指)油轮
entry.def: A tanker is a very large ship used for transporting large quantities of gas or liquid, especially oil.

example.ex: A Greek oil tanker has run aground.

entry.tran: 大卡车;铁路罐车;运输机
entry.def: A tanker is a large truck, railway vehicle, or aircraft used for transporting large quantities of a substance.

example.ex: ...an accident involving a petrol tanker on the M27, east of Southampton.
example.tran: 在南安普敦以东的 27 号高速公路上发生的一起车祸，其中有一辆油罐车

means.word_mean: 1. a cargo ship designed to carry crude oil in bulk
2. a soldier who drives a tank

jushi.english: The harbour admits large tankers and freighters.
jushi.chinese: 这个港口容得下巨型油船和货轮。

jushi.english: Last night a cargo ship collided with a tanker carrying crude oil.
jushi.chinese: 昨晚一艘货轮与一艘载着原油的油轮相撞。

jushi.english: This oil tanker has the greatest tonnage of any built in Japan.
jushi.chinese: 这艘油船是日本所造的油船中吨位最大的一艘。
